definition: to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

sentences.english: Do not use fabric softener. Wash dark colours separately.
sentences.chinese: 不要使用柔順劑洗滌，與淺色衣物分開洗滌。

sentences.english: A daily conditioning shampoo to help protect hair, leaving it soft and manageable.
sentences.chinese: 能有效改善受損髮質，令秀髮回覆柔順。

sentences.english: This is an interesting execution for fabric conditioner from Australia.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個來自澳大利亞的有趣的衣物柔順劑廣告。

sentences.english: He kneads you until you are pliant;
sentences.chinese: 他揉捏你們，直至你們柔順。

sentences.english: That would be this soft and warm?
sentences.chinese: 那將會是一樣的溫軟和柔順嗎？

sentences.english: Ok, I can pick something else up on the way.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，我可以在路上買別的柔順劑。
他表面上的柔順使人人受騙。

sentences.english: All of this is balanced with fine grain tannins and a soft acid finish that give balance and drinkability.
sentences.chinese: 優質的單寧感和柔順的酸度構成了很好的平衡。

sentences.english: Maggie smiled, her long black hair flowing and almost glowing with sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 瑪吉口露微笑，她的頭髮細長而柔順，烏黑而發亮。

sentences.english: Soft, fleshy and long palate with cherry-jam notes.
sentences.chinese: 柔順，新鮮爽潔，回味無窮的櫻桃果醬。

sentences.english: Great stories still flow but now there are smoothies in the picture.
sentences.chinese: 沒有咖啡仍然有好故事湧現，而且圖景更加柔順。

sentences.english: Supple, with a dominant of red fruits; the finale is long, with a spicy characteristic.
sentences.chinese: 柔順，有強烈的紅色水果味，餘味悠長，略帶香料味。

sentences.english: Nure-onna is typically seen at the water's edge, washing her long, flowing hair.
sentences.chinese: 人們通常會在水邊看見濡女清洗她長而柔順的頭髮。

sentences.english: Ross: Ok, ok, now what is wrong with my Snuggles ?
sentences.chinese: 好了，好了，現在我的斯耐格柔順劑怎麼了？

sentences.english: Leaves hair ultra-soft, fresh-smelling and clean.
sentences.chinese: 洗後頭發特別柔順，氣味清新，清潔。

sentences.english: Deep ruby-red coloured wine , of excellent structure, harmonious with soft tannins.
sentences.chinese: 深紅寶石色，結構感優異，柔順的單寧酸。

definition: Guangze county in Nanping 南平[Nan2 ping2] Fujian
to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
